chargeHist.descr: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D. Martinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
**Two days sentence credit if revoked from Probation**

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

4:04 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher D. Martinson in court.  Attorney Susan M Meade in court for Christopher D. Martinson. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 1 and 3 of the Information. Court accepts pleas and finds defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
The Court withholds sentencing and places the defendant on Probation for 18 months with conditions: 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with A.G., M.M. or Officer Montgomery except when they are acting in their official capacity.
Defendant to pay court costs and provide a DNA sample. 
There is two days credit if defendant is revoked from Probation.
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

10:15 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher D. Martinson in court.  Attorney Susan M Meade in court for Christopher D. Martinson. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
Parties are close to an agreement. A status conference (possible plea) is scheduled for 5/23/22 at 4:00 PM (in person).

Case called at 9:35 AM.
Defendant Christopher D. Martinson in court.  Attorney Susan M Meade in court for Christopher D. Martinson.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing.
Branch 2 to schedule ARGN.

Conditions:
No contact with Officer Montgomery except in their official capacity.
No acts or threats of violence against A.G., M.M.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.

(11:13 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher D. Martinson appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Christopher D. Martinson.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on March 7, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with Officer Montgomery except in their official capacity.
No acts or threats of violence against A.G., M.M.
